full_summary:
### Multidisciplinary Engineering Consultant Services, Newfoundland and Labrador

#### Tender Details

* **Tender Reference Number**: MX-22608420144
* **Amendment Number**: 2
* **Solicitation Number**: NL22SO01
* **Publication Date**: November 2, 2022
* **Tender Closing Date**: December 12, 2022, 2:00 PM EST
* **Tender Status**: Expired

#### Procurement Details

* **Procurement Method**: Competitive - Open Bidding
* **Trade Agreements**: Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA), Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA), and World Trade Organization Agreement on Government Procurement (WTO GPA)

#### Contracting Entity

* **Contracting Entity Name**: Defence Construction Canada / Construction de Défense Canada
* **Contracting Entity Address**: 350 Albert St, 19th Floor, Ottawa, Ontario, K1A 0K3, Canada

#### Scope of Work

Defence Construction Canada (DCC) invites consulting firms to submit abbreviated proposals for a Standing Offer (SO) contract to provide multidisciplinary engineering consultant services. The SO contract will be for a period of three years with a maximum estimated value of $750,000.00. Firms will be required to provide professional services as and when required to meet the specific needs of the Department of National Defence (DND) in Newfoundland and Labrador.

#### Evaluation Criteria

Firms will be evaluated based on the criteria established in the Request for Abbreviated Proposals (RFAP) document. The Security Requirements for this project are also outlined in the RFAP document.

#### Bidding and Documents

Bidding and documents for this tender can be found on the MERX website at [https://www.merx.com](https://www.merx.com). The document package includes the RFAP, specifications, and evaluation criteria. Firms are required to submit their proposals through the MERX Electronic Bidding System by the tender closing date and time. The deadline for submission is December 12, 2022, 2:00 PM EST.  Please note that users must register on MERX as a bidder before submitting an electronic bid. Following the evaluation process, the contract award results will be made available on the Defence Construction Canada website. 
Contact information:
* 
* Email: camille.attia@dcc-cdc.gc.ca
* Phone: 613-715-0564
